intro: Ipomoea stenocolpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive narrow base, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Ipomoea stenocolpa is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other flowering vines and herbs.
